item.title: Setting up (Neo)vim for React development
item.description: It’s been 8 months since I have been using (neo)vim as my primary text editor. Initially it was incredibly tough to adopt and use it in work. Well that would be another story to tell. Back then I was working mostly in backend using CoffeeScript (I know ðŸ™ˆ). VS Code had a little support for CoffeeScript so I didn’t had any problems using vim full time. But things changed drastically when I moved into UI development this year.
